5.10 <t0/>Minimum anchor spacing and edge distance, as well as minimum member thickness, must comply with the values given in this report.
5.10 <t0/>最小錨固間距和邊距，以及最小構件厚度必須遵照本報告的數值。
5.12 <t0/>The fischer FIS EM Adhesive Anchoring System is not permitted to support fire-resistive construction.
5.12 <t0/> fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固系統不可支援防火結構。

5.13 <t0/>Since an ICC-ES acceptance criteria for evaluating data to determine the performance of adhesive anchors subjected to fatigue or shock loading is unavailable at this time, the use of these anchors under such conditions is beyond the scope of this report.
5.13 <t0/>由於無法使用 ICC-ES 驗收標準評估黏合錨固在疲勞或衝擊負荷下的性能，因此在這些情況下使用錨固便超出了本報告的範圍。
5.14 <t0/>Use of zinc-plated carbon steel threaded rods or steel reinforcing bars is limited to dry, interior locations.
5.14 <t0/>僅可在乾燥的室內使用鍍鋅碳鋼螺紋柱或鋼筋柱。
5.15 <t0/>Use of hot-dipped galvanized carbon steel and stainless steel rods is permitted for exterior exposure or damp environments.
5.15 <t0/>室外或潮濕環境則可使用熱鍍鋅碳鋼和不鏽鋼柱。
5.16 <t0/>Steel anchoring materials in contact with preservative-treated and fire-retardant-treated wood must be of zinc-coated carbon steel or stainless steel.
5.16 <t0/>接觸防腐劑處理和防火阻燃處理木材的鋼錨固材料，必須使用鍍鋅碳鋼或不銹鋼製成。
5.17 <t0/>Periodic special inspection must be provided in accordance with Section 4.3 of this report.
5.17 <t0/>必須依照本報告章節 4.3 提供定期專項檢查。

5.18 <t0/>Installation of anchors in horizontal or upwardly inclined orientations to resist sustained tension loads shall be performed by personnel certified by an applicable certification program in accordance with ACI 318 D.9.2.2 or D.9.2.3.

Design Strength in Seismic Design Categories C, D, E and F:<t0/> In structures assigned to Seismic Design Category C, D, E or F under the IBC or IRC, design anchors in accordance with ACI 318 Section D.3.3.
抗震設計類別 C、D、E 或 F 的設計強度：<t0/>IBC 或 IRC 的抗震設計類別 C、D、E 或 F 的結構，設計錨固需遵照 ACI 318 章節 D.3.3。
Design a mat system that will fit in the containment area or around and under the machine.
設計一個符合機台區域的吸收墊系統，置於機台周圍及下方。
Design according to EN 1992-1-1:2004+AC:2010 and Annex B 2.
Design parameters are based on ACI 318-11 for use with the 2009, 2006, and 2003 IBC unless noted otherwise in Sections 4.1.1 through 4.1.11 of this report.
本報告章節 4.1.1 4.1.至 4.1.11 若無註明，設計參數應遵照 2009、2006 和 2003 IBC 使用的 ACI 318-11。
Design parameters are provided in Tables 5 through 10 of this report.
本報告表 5 至表 10 提供了設計參數。

Ductility: <t0/>In accordance with ACI 318 D.1, in order for a steel element to be considered ductile, the tested elongation must be at least 14 percent and reduction of area must be at least 30 percent.
延展性：<t0/>根據 ACI 318 D.1，為了要滿足鋼材之韌性，測試伸長率必須至少為 14% 且面積減少必須至少為 30%，
Due to the above factors, the local heat ﬂux on the bottom plate is moderate during the ejection phase of the expansion chamber.
基於以上因素，膨脹腔體排出相於底板上之局部熱通量一般。
Due to the eccentric location of the power cylinders, Fig. 9 again shows that the local heat ﬂux distribution is not axisymmetric, especially near both entrances of the regenerative channel.
由於動力汽缸的偏心設計，圖 9 再次展現出局部熱通量分布非軸對稱，特別是接近蓄熱通道入口處。
Due to the expansion and compression of engine volume, heat<t0/> <t1/>input and output can happen at the hot end, cold end, and on the<t2/> <t3/>wall of regenerative channel.
由於引擎體積之膨脹與壓縮，熱量輸入與輸出可發生於熱端、冷端與蓄熱通道牆面，
Due to these challenges, many attempts to apply CFD approach on Stirling engines focused on separated components such as combustion chamber of the heater [9].
因為這些挑戰性，許多史特林引擎的計算連體力學方法將重點放於單一元件，如加熱器燃燒腔體 [9]。

此外，由於其尺寸較小，引擎不配有蓄熱器，蓄熱藉由工作氣體於膨脹和壓縮腔體間來回流經換氣活塞與換氣汽缸內壁之間的狹縫；即以換氣汽缸內壁固體材料作為蓄熱器以儲存和釋放熱量。

In addition, due to the fact displacer and power cylinders are eccentric, the temperature distributions are not axisymmetric, and there exist pronounced 3D phenomena throughout the entire engine cycle.

In the aspect of coding, simulating the reciprocating motions of displacer and power piston requires the use of moving mesh techniques which introduce complex algorithm and raise the difﬁculty of coding.
一方面為程式編寫，模擬換氣活塞及動力活塞往復運動需要使用移動網格，需使用複雜的演算法而提高了程式編寫的困難度。

In the aspect ﬂow physics, the gas ﬂow is compressible; the heat transfer mechanism<t0/> <t1/>is conjugate heat transfer, involving solid and ﬂuid media; and in most cases, the ﬂow is turbulent; and these give rise to complex heat and mass transfer processes.
一方面為流體力學，氣體流為可壓縮的；熱傳機制結合了熱傳導，包含固體與液體介質；而多數情況流體為紊流；使得熱量與質量傳導過程更加複雜化。

In the compression chamber, the average temperature ﬂuctuation is within the rage of 20 K. Both average temperature<t4/> <t5/>variations show only one peak and one valley, corresponding to one injection phase and one ejection phase within an engine cycle.
壓縮腔體中，平均溫度變化範圍小於 20 K。兩組平均溫度皆只有一峰值與一谷值，分別對應至單一引擎循環中的注入相與排出相。
In the ejection phase, however, the general tendency is decreasing but it brieﬂy rebounds twice during the descent.
然而於排出相，整體趨勢為降低，但降低過程中有兩次反彈，

In the ejection phase, the motions of displacer and power piston also create a sort of heat transfer effect similar to impingement, but this effect acts on a much larger region and also promotes heat transfer effectively especially in the compression chamber where the negative heat transfer is further boosted by the rising of gas temperature due to compression of the entire engine volume.
排出相中，換氣與動力活塞之運動也造成類似衝擊之熱傳導，但此效應作用區域更大且同時特別對於壓縮腔體提升了熱傳效率，由於引擎總體積壓縮增加了氣體溫度而進一步加強了其負熱傳導。

而膨脹腔體中，排出相與整體引擎體積膨脹過程不完全相同，氣體與熱端牆面之間經由氣體膨脹加速正熱傳導機制而加大溫差量的效應並不顯著。

The combined motions of displacer and power pistons cause gas to ﬂow forwards and backwards between the expansion and compression chambers, while the motion of the power pistons expands or compresses the total volume of the engine, which in turn introduces cooling or heating effects on the working gas.

The complicated heat transfer behaviors in the engine result in highly non-uniform temperature distributions in all sections of the engine at most of the time in an engine cycle.

The gas that ﬂows forwards and backwards between expansion and compression chambers introduces very strong heat convection effect in both chambers and results in complicated heat transfer behaviors between the gas and the solid boundaries and highly non-uniform temperature distributions across the chambers at any given moment.
來回流經膨脹和壓縮腔體的氣體流於兩個腔體中造成非常強烈的熱對流效應，因而造成氣體與固體邊界之間複雜的熱傳特性，且所有時間下腔體之間的溫度分布皆高度不均勻。

fischer FIS EM ADHESIVE ANCHORING SYSTEM FOR CRACKED AND UNCRACKED CONCRETE
用於龜裂和無龜裂混凝土之 fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固系統

fischer FIS EM Adhesive Anchors are used to resist static, wind and earthquake (Seismic Design Categories A through F) tension and shear loads in cracked and uncracked normal-weight concrete having a specified compressive strength, <t0/>f′ <t1/>c<t2/>, of 2,500 psi to 8,500 psi <t3/>(17.2 MPa to 58.6 MPa).
fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固用於龜裂及無龜裂之一般重量混凝土以抵抗靜力、風以及地震 (抗震設計類別 A 至 F) 產生之張力及剪力負荷，其壓應力強度 <t0/>f′ <t1/>c<t2/> 介於 2,500 psi 至 8,500 psi <t3/>(17.2 MPa 至 58.6 MPa) 之間。

fischer FIS EM adhesive anchors are permitted to be installed in concrete that is cracked or that may be expected to crack during the service life of the anchor, subject to the conditions of this report.
根據本報告的條件，fischer FIS EM 黏合錨固可安裝在龜裂或預期在使用期間會龜裂之混凝土。
fischer FIS EM adhesive anchors are recognized for use to resist short- and long-term loads, including wind and earthquake loads, subject to the conditions of this report.
根據本報告的條件，fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固已公認可承受短時間和長時間的負荷，包括風力和地震負荷。

fischer FIS EM adhesive anchors must be installed in accordance with this report and the manufacturer’s printed installation instructions included in the adhesive packaging and described in Figure 4 of this report.
fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固系統必須遵照本報告、黏著劑包裝所附的製造商安裝說明以及本報告圖 4 之指示進行安裝。

fischer FIS EM adhesive is identified by packaging labeled with the manufacturer’s name (fischerwerke) and address, product name, lot number, expiration date, and the evaluation report number (ESR-1990).
fischer FIS EM 黏著劑包裝上標有製造商名稱 (fischerwerke)、地址、產品名稱、批號、有效期限以及評估報告編號 (ESR-1990)。
fischer FIS EM adhesive may only be used with continuously threaded steel rods or deformed steel reinforcing bars described in Tables 2, 3, and 4 of this report.
fischer FIS EM 黏著劑只能用於本報告之表 2、3 以及 4 中所述之連續螺紋鋼柱或變形之鋼筋柱強化。
fischer adhesive anchoring system FIS EM Fischer FIS EM is an epoxy adhesive anchoring system for fastenings in normal weight concrete.
fischer FIS EM 黏結錨固系統 FIS EM Fischer FIS EM 為用於固定一般重量混凝土之環氧樹脂黏著劑。

<t0/><t1/>We provide a multitude of specially designed spill kits to meet the needs of various industries.

<t0/><t1/>We save the environment by providing a green product that doesn’t just pick up oil, but encapsulates it and locks it away until that oil can be broken down into safer elements.
 我們提供的環保產品不僅能吸附油污，也能封鎖住油污直到其分解成較安全的元素以保護環境。
<t0/><t1/>We save their money by providing a much more cost effective way to manager their spill and leak control.
 我們提供更具成本效益的洩漏控制管理方式為客戶節省金錢。
<t0/><t1/>We save their time by providing a product that outperforms every product currently on the market.
 我們提供目前市場上最佳的產品為客戶節省時間。
